author: Odeinoichus
title: He Can Fly!
review:
Set #71012 Peter Pan: The boy who never grows up joins the cast of classic era Disney Characters and he's quite a treat.

Peter features a brand new head piece with his little green hat, scruffy hair and elfin ears and the red feather, it's a great new piece with so many potential uses. Again he has dual-molded legs and torso, with short sleeves on the arms and minor printing for the frayed edges of his shirt-sleeves and extra printing on the legs to enhance the look. His accessories are actually gold, not silver as the official image indicates and I'm not entirely sure why they changed it.

Overall I strongly recommend Pan, he's one of the better offerings from this series and has so many uses with his parts and print.

author: Lobo_da_boss_
title: A strange advertisement error
review:
Opening;

Peter pan is an iconic character that Lego nailed in 2016s Disney series one , but one part of the figure was falsely advertised .

The Minifigure-

The hat , hair and eat combo is an exclusive dual moulded part accurate to the 2D animated character , the head showcases a thrilled expression , the torso is simplistic but perfect , the arms are dual moulded and feature subtle rip prints on the sleeves and the legs are also dual moulded with side and front printing .

The accessories -

His accessories include two GOLD daggers which for some reason are advertised as silver everywhere which is really false advertisement . The stand is the standard black CMF stand .

In conclusion -

this is an exceptional figure from an exceptional series and ignoring the false advertisement  it is just too good not to recommend .
